current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To expand the Federal Funding Accountability and
		  Transparency Act of 2006 to increase accountability and transparency in Federal
		  spending, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Digital Accountability and
			 Transparency Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the
The purposes of this Act are to—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
by disclosing
			 direct Federal agency expenditures and linking Federal contract, loan, and
			 grant spending information to programs of Federal agencies in order to enable
			 taxpayers and policy makers to track Federal spending more effectively;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006

text.#text:
simplify
			 reporting for entities receiving Federal funds by streamlining reporting
			 requirements and reducing compliance costs while improving transparency;
			 and

improve the
			 quality of data submitted to USASpending.gov by holding Federal agencies
			 accountable for the completeness and accuracy of the data submitted.
